intro: Wurmbea centralis subsp. australis, commonly known as the Southern Wurmbea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its perennial growth habit and rhizomatous structure. The plant produces small, white to greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters during the spring season. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, growing from the base of the plant. Wurmbea centralis subsp. australis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
